intro: Veronica nenningii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and streambanks, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Veronica nenningii is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
